name: cifti-dilate
author: Connectome Workbench Developers
description:
Dilate a cifti file.

For all data values designated as bad, if they neighbor a good value or are within the specified distance of a good value in the same kind of model, replace the value with a distance weighted average of nearby good values, otherwise set the value to zero.  If -nearest is specified, it will use the value from the closest good value within range instead of a weighted average.  When the input file contains label data, nearest dilation is used on the surface, and weighted popularity is used in the volume.

The -*-corrected-areas options are intended for dilating on group average surfaces, but it is only an approximate correction for the reduction of structure in a group average surface.

If -bad-brainordinate-roi is specified, all values, including those with value zero, are good, except for locations with a positive value in the ROI.  If it is not specified, only values equal to zero are bad.

inputs.name: direction
inputs.description: which dimension to dilate along, ROW or COLUMN

inputs.name: surface_distance
inputs.description: the distance to dilate on surfaces, in mm

inputs.name: volume_distance
inputs.description: the distance to dilate in the volume, in mm

inputs.name: left_surface
inputs.description: specify the left surface to use

type.name: left_surface
type.description: specify the left surface to use

inputs.name: opt_left_corrected_areas_area_metric
inputs.description: vertex areas to use instead of computing them from the left surface: the corrected vertex areas, as a metric

inputs.name: right_surface
inputs.description: specify the right surface to use

type.name: right_surface
type.description: specify the right surface to use

inputs.name: opt_right_corrected_areas_area_metric
inputs.description: vertex areas to use instead of computing them from the right surface: the corrected vertex areas, as a metric

inputs.name: cerebellum_surface
inputs.description: specify the cerebellum surface to use

type.name: cerebellum_surface
type.description: specify the cerebellum surface to use

inputs.name: opt_cerebellum_corrected_areas_area_metric
inputs.description: vertex areas to use instead of computing them from the cerebellum surface: the corrected vertex areas, as a metric

inputs.name: opt_bad_brainordinate_roi_roi_cifti
inputs.description: specify an roi of brainordinates to overwrite, rather than zeros: cifti dscalar or dtseries file, positive values denote brainordinates to have their values replaced

inputs.name: opt_nearest
inputs.description: use nearest good value instead of a weighted average

inputs.name: opt_merged_volume
inputs.description: treat volume components as if they were a single component

inputs.name: opt_legacy_mode
inputs.description: use the math from v1.3.2 and earlier for weighted dilation
